thread.title: Three-Legged Pooch Gets ‘Puppy Bowl’ Underdog Award
thread.title_full: Three-Legged Pooch Gets ‘Puppy Bowl’ Underdog Award

title: Three-Legged Pooch Gets ‘Puppy Bowl’ Underdog Award
text: Superfan TV • February 6, 2017 Sunday wasn’t just a big day for football fans — particularly those of the New England Patriots — it was also an exciting day for animal lovers: The Puppy Bowl , Kitten Bowl , and, of course, the Fish Bowl competed for animal fans’ attention. Watching fish swim around isn’t that exciting, but seeing puppies and kittens play around is one of the greatest things on earth. This year’s Puppy Bowl featured numerous playful pooches, but one three-legged dog named Lucky stood out from the rest. Lucky was found abandoned underneath a porch, and as if that weren’t bad enough, she later broke her leg and had to get it amputated. Luckily, Lucky has made a full recovery and, along with her brother Ricky, was able to play in the legendary Puppy Bowl . While Lucky’s time in the game was limited, her impact was not, as Animal Planet announced on its Twitter page that Lucky had won the Underdog Award. Watch: Fish Bowl IV Throws Subtle Shade at Donald Trump and Others Tell us what you think! Hit us up on Twitter , Facebook , or Instagram , or leave your comments below. And check out our host, Cynthia LuCiette, on Twitter , Facebook , or Instagram .
